Posts.Content: Mar 11, 2019 06:48PM Mommyoffour wrote: hi! So glad you posted and it noticed me gosh I haven't thought wbout this forever. I had a nipple sparing bilateral mastectomy April 24 2018 and am thrilled. No worries. It's over. Best choice for me and my family. You have to follow your own path but I was so happy with mine! Feel and looos great my nodes were all negative surgery did stink but it was just a few hard months and then it's OVER
Posts.Title: Anyone have a PMB for ADH/ALH Mommyoffour CasM

Posts.Content: Mommyoffour wrote: Hi I've just scheduled a PBM for ALH. I have some other risk factors (dense breasts, many aunts both sides w BC, and have had several lumpectomies). Found the ALH during a cosmetic breast reduction. Was offered Tamixofen, started it but then several doctors and friends suggested to consider PBM. I would love to connect w women like me who don't have cancer - have this “pre-cancer" - and went the PBM route. Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone have a PMB for ADH/ALH Mommyoffour CasM
